communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Samuel Phillips Huntington (April 18, 1927 – December 24, 2008) - American political scientist, adviser, and Cold War strategist (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_P._Huntington )

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies.  For reference, the associated file numbers for these records provided by the FBI are: 161-HQ-12494, 100-HQ-127094 Serial HQ1022, 100-HQ-481695 Serial HQ539, 100-HQ-459279, and 105-WF-20251 Serial 24.

If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Malcolm Muggeridge (24 March 1903 – 14 November 1990) - English journalist and satirist (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malcolm_Muggeridge )

Please conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. For reference, the associated file number for these records provided by the FBI is 100-HQ-243140.

If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the #DetentionKills Transparency Initiative of Al Otro Lado, we respectfully request copies of all records created by ICE in response to the ICE FOIA request designated 2023-ICAP-00248 and 2023-ICFO-04101 by ICE FOIA. This request was sent to ICE FOIA on November 15, 2022, with a request for Expedited Processing. 

Thank you in advance for your timely responses. 

Sincerely, 
Andrew Free
#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Donald Aspinwall Allan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents or files pertaining to Donald Aspinwall Allan, an obituary of whom was published in The Washington Post on August 5, 2006: https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/2006/08/05/journalist-and-cia-spy-donald-aspinall-allan/0cff5746-b65c-47fc-8146-fd5e948a3ed3/

Allan was born on December 6, 1922 in Washington, D.C. He passed away on August 2, 2006 in Woodside, California.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Runa Sandvik
